alert.note: Alert for Eastern Orleans; Lower Plaquemines; Lower St. Bernard; Southeast St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued December 14 at 3:27PM CST until December 16 at 6:00AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 AM CST FRIDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding expected. For the Coastal Flood Watch, moderate to significant coastal flooding possible. * WHERE...In Louisiana, Lower Plaquemines, Lower St. Bernard, Southeast St. Tammany and Eastern Orleans Parishes. In Mississippi, Southern Hancock County. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 9 PM this evening to 6 AM CST Friday. For the Coastal Flood Watch, from Friday evening through late Friday night. * IMPACTS...For the he coastal flood advisory, flooding of low lying lots, roads and parks, with only isolated road closures. For the coastal flood watch, numerous roads may be closed. Low lying property may be inundated, with flooding of some unelevated structures.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Orleans; Lower Plaquemines; Lower St. Bernard; Southeast St. Tammany
